p: In order to statistically study the changes in community composition between treatments and throughout the experimental period, a GLM was applied in pairwise comparisons at class level. The GLM analyses showed strong and significant differences ( p-values < 0.01) between the community compositions based on sampling occasion (i.e., a temporal effect) and due to the addition of tDOM for all pair-wise comparisons (Table 1 and Supplementary Table S3, overall effects). However, this overall analysis gave no indication of a pollutant-based treatment effect (Table 1, overall effects). Similarly, a PCoA indicated a tendency for closer clustering of samples from non-tDOM treatments on the one hand, and tDOM treatments on the other (Figure 5), although the temporal progression (i.e., sampling time) was clearly a more dominant factor.
